org.ow2.proactive.authentication

Class AuthenticationImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.authentication.AuthenticationImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.objectweb.proactive.Active, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive, Authentication, Loggable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RMAuthenticationImpl

    public abstract class AuthenticationImpl
extends Object
implements Authentication, org.objectweb.proactive.RunActive
    An active object responsible for authentication.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9.1
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthenticationImpl

        public AuthenticationImpl()
        Empty constructor

      • AuthenticationImpl

        public AuthenticationImpl(String jaasPath,
                          String privPath,
                          String pubPath)
        Default constructor

        Loads jaas.config and stores it in global system property, also locates keypair used for authentication: public key is used to encrypt credentials to make the old deprecated API still compatible, private key is used to decrypt credentials in the new API.

        Parameters:
        jaasPath - path to the jaas configuration file
        privPath - path to the private key file
        pubPath - path to the public key file

    • Method Detail

      • getLoginMethod

        Returns:
        a string which represents the login method.

      • authenticate

        public Subject authenticate(Credentials cred)
                     throws LoginException
        Performs login.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface Authentication
        Parameters:
        cred - encrypted username and password
        Returns:
        the name of the user logged
        Throws:
        LoginException - if username or password is incorrect.

      • getPublicKey

        public PublicKey getPublicKey()
                       throws LoginException
        Request this AuthenticationImpl's public key.

        The public key provided by this method can be used to create encrypted credentials with Credentials.createCredentials(String, String, PublicKey). The private key corresponding to this public key will be used for decryption.

        Specified by:
        getPublicKey in interface Authentication
        Returns:
        this AuthenticationImpl's public key
        Throws:
        LoginException - the key could not be retrieved

        Returns:
